page.title: 02A farmer's day (a.m.)
page.content: A typical day will vary according to the season. A typical June day would begin fairly early with calf feeding,then a walk over the fields to see the suckler cows and calves and check that none are sick.Fences must be checked and if the bull has broken the rail over the water trough a temporary repair must be made.After breakfast our eldest daughter must be taken to meet the school bus,then on to see the heifers on grass keep at the neighbours,check steers and ewes with lambs,getting back to the house by 9am to make and recieve phone calls to vet,feed merchant etc. If the weather is fine the tractor will be fuelled and hitched up to the implement such as mower,hay tedder or baler,before having a cup of coffee and going to the fields till lunchtime
